entry.summary: The Collapse Subtotal toggle functionality has been fixed and now correctly collapses subtotals in table visualizations.
entry.title: Fixed: Collapse Subtotal Toggle Fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the maximum column limit warning could obscure the contents of a visualization. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The maximum column limit warning no longer obscures visualizations. This issue is now resolved.
entry.title: Fixed: Visualization column limit warning fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where users couldn't sort tables that included pivoted values. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Users can now sort tables with pivoted values as expected. This resolves a previous issue that prevented this functionality.
entry.title: Fixed: Table sorting with pivoted values fixed

entry.content: LookML dashboards that aren't deployed to production can no longer be moved into folders other than the LookML Dashboards folder.
entry.summary: Fixed an issue where LookML dashboards not deployed to production could be moved to folders other than the LookML Dashboards folder.
entry.title: Fixed: LookML Dashboards Deployment

entry.content: LookML project parse errors now include the LookML file path as well as the line number of the error.
entry.summary: LookML project parse errors now include the LookML file path and line number.
entry.title: Fixed: LookML Parse Errors Improved

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where Databricks connections that used OAuth could not be saved if the password field was blank. You can now use OAuth without entering a password on the connections page.
entry.summary: Fixed an issue where Databricks connections using OAuth could not be saved if the password field was blank. Users can now successfully configure these connections without needing to enter a password.
entry.title: Fixed: Databricks connections with OAuth can now be saved without a password

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where users were sometimes unable to add line breaks to table calculations. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Users can now add line breaks to table calculations without issues. This feature is working as expected.
entry.title: Fixed: Line breaks in table calculations fixed

entry.content:
An issue has been fixed where certain countries would not be displayed when a custom TopoJSON file was used. The following country names are now supported:

  • Czechia for Czech Republic
  • Eswatini for Swaziland
  • Brunei Darussalam for Brunei
  • North Macedonia for Macedonia
  • Timor-Leste for East Timor
entry.summary: Fixed an issue where some countries weren't displayed with custom TopoJSON files. Supported country names now include Czechia, Eswatini, Brunei Darussalam, North Macedonia, and Timor-Leste.
entry.title: Fixed: Country display issue fixed

entry.content: The Prerender iframes for custom visualizations feature is now generally available on the Admin > Content Guardrails page.
entry.summary: The Prerender iframes for custom visualizations feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Prerender iframes for custom visualizations

entry.content: The Smart single value text size feature is now generally available on the Admin > General Settings page.
entry.summary: The Smart single value text size feature is now available on the Admin > General Settings page.
entry.title: Feature: Smart single value text size

entry.content: The API endpoint search_lookml_dashboards is now generally available. This endpoint is similar to the search_dashboards endpoint except that it searches LookML dashboards instead of user-defined dashboards.
entry.summary: The search_lookml_dashboards API endpoint is now generally available. It allows you to search specifically for LookML dashboards, distinguishing them from user-defined ones.
entry.title: Feature: LookML Dashboards Search API Now Available

entry.content: The Data History Playback feature is now generally available on the Admin > Settings page.
entry.summary: The Data History Playback feature has been launched and is now accessible on the Admin > Settings page. This feature allows users to review past data changes and activity.
entry.title: Feature: Data History Playback Now Available

entry.content: The Reduce Filter Queries feature is now generally available on the Admin > Settings page.
entry.summary: The Reduce Filter Queries feature is now available on the Admin > Settings page.
entry.title: Feature: Reduce Filter Queries

entry.content: Looker admins can no longer create or edit individual users' API keys. Instead, from the Admin > Users page, admins can enable users to manage their own API keys. Once a user has API key management enabled, they can create, view, edit, and delete their API keys from their Looker account page. Note: This item was changed on October 9, 2025 to specify that it supports Looker (Google Cloud core) only, and it was changed again on October 22, 2025 to indicate that it's a breaking change.
entry.summary: Looker admins can no longer manage individual users' API keys. Users can now manage their own API keys from their account page after admins enable this feature.
entry.title: Breaking: API key management changes for Looker admins

entry.content: The Prerender iframes for custom visualizations feature is now out of Labs and generally available on the Admin > Content Guardrails page.
entry.summary: Prerender iframes for custom visualizations are now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Prerender iframes for custom visualizations

entry.content: The Smart single value text size feature is now out of Labs and generally available on the Admin > General Settings page.
entry.summary: The Smart single value text size feature is no longer in Labs and is now generally available. You can find this feature on the Admin > General Settings page.
entry.title: Feature: Smart single value text size feature is now generally available

entry.content: The API endpoint search_lookml_dashboards is now out of Labs and generally available. This endpoint is similar to the search_dashboards endpoint except that it searches LookML dashboards instead of user-defined dashboards.
entry.summary: The search_lookml_dashboards API endpoint is now generally available. This feature allows you to search LookML dashboards.
entry.title: Feature: LookML Dashboards Search API Now Generally Available

entry.content: The Data History Playback Labs feature is is now out of Labs and generally available on the Admin > Settings page.
entry.summary: The Data History Playback feature has been released from Labs and is now generally available. You can find it on the Admin > Settings page.
entry.title: Feature: Data History Playback Now Generally Available

entry.content: The Reduce Filter Queries Labs feature is now is now out of Labs and generally available on the Admin > Settings page.
entry.summary: The Reduce Filter Queries feature has been released from Labs and is now generally available on the Admin > Settings page.
entry.title: Feature: Reduce Filter Queries Now Generally Available

entry.content: The sql_preamble parameter now supports Liquid statements. This update is supported on Looker 25.12 and later versions.
entry.summary: The sql_preamble parameter now supports Liquid statements on Looker 25.12 and later versions.
entry.title: Feature: Liquid statements support in sql_preamble

entry.content:
The following features are coming soon for use with Conversational Analytics:

  • New model-specific Looker permissions are available to manage and use the Conversational Analytics data agents that are created to chat with Looker Explores. You can grant these to users as part of a custom role, or use one of two new default roles, Conversational Analytics Agent Manager and Conversational Analytics User, to manage and use agents, respectively.
  • You can now select up to five Looker Explores as data sources for a data agent.
  • You can now share data agents to let other users chat with your agent and its Explores.

Note: This release note was published prematurely. It was amended on October 8, 2025 to reflect that these features are coming soon and amended on October 14, 2025 to indicate that the features have been launched.
entry.summary: New model-specific Looker permissions are available to manage and use Conversational Analytics data agents. You can now select up to five Looker Explores as data sources for a data agent and share data agents with other users.
entry.title: Feature: New features for Conversational Analytics

entry.content: You can now connect to your Looker instance with the Gemini CLI using a dedicated Gemini extension. The Gemini extension can run queries, create Looks and dashboards, and retrieve elements of your LookML models.
entry.summary: Connect to your Looker instance using the Gemini CLI with a new extension. Run queries, create Looks and dashboards, and retrieve LookML model elements directly from your IDE.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini CLI now connects to Looker

entry.content:

entry.content: The Looker-Excel Connector is now generally available. When your Looker admin enables the Looker-Excel Connector on the BI Connections admin page, Looker Explores display the Open in Excel option in the Explore gear menu. This option downloads the Explore results to a Windows PC in a format that Microsoft Excel recognizes.

entry.title: Feature: Looker-Excel Connector Now Available

entry.content: The LookerPower BI Connector is now supported for customer-hosted Looker instances and for Looker (Google Cloud core) instances that use private connections. Note: This item was added on September 19, 2025.
entry.summary: The LookerPower BI Connector is now supported for customer-hosted Looker instances and for Looker (Google Cloud core) instances utilizing private connections. This expansion enhances connectivity options for users with specific deployment needs.
entry.title: Feature: LookerPower BI Connector Now Available for Customer-Hosted and Private Connection Instances

entry.content: The LookerTableau BI Connector is now supported for customer-hosted Looker instances and for Looker (Google Cloud core) instances that use private connections. Note: This item was added on September 19, 2025.
entry.summary: The LookerTableau BI Connector now supports customer-hosted Looker instances and Looker (Google Cloud core) instances utilizing private connections. This expansion enhances flexibility for various deployment scenarios.
entry.title: Feature: LookerTableau BI Connector Now Supported for Customer-Hosted and Private Instances

entry.content:
Looker 25.16 contains the following accessibility improvements:

  • Improved keyboard navigation for embed folders.
  • Added ARIA labels to filter drop-down menu items.
  • Added ARIA labels to schedule options.
  • Added focus rings to navigation links.
  • Improved VoiceOver support for filter navigation.
  • Added the ability for users to close modals by using the Esc key. Users will be prevented from closing modals this way if there are unsaved changes in the modal.
entry.summary: Looker 25.16 includes several accessibility enhancements, such as improved keyboard navigation, ARIA labels for filters and schedules, better VoiceOver support, and the ability to close modals with the Esc key.
entry.title: Fixed: Accessibility Improvements in Looker 25.16

entry.content: When you upload a p12 file to a database connection, Looker now checks that it is a valid file before completing the upload.
entry.summary: Looker now validates p12 files during database connection uploads to ensure they are valid before completing the process.
entry.title: Fixed: P12 validation improved

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where adding multiple filters to the same field could cause filter conditions to overwrite each other. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Multiple filters on the same field no longer overwrite each other.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed filter bug

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where changing the size of a visualization could cause the visualization to flicker. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The visualization flickering issue that occurred when resizing has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: Visualization flickering issue fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where users could enter color codes that were longer than six characters when they were updating custom color collections. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Users can no longer enter color codes longer than six characters when updating custom color collections. This resolves a previous issue and ensures the feature functions correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed color code length issue

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where Explore drill links would not open correctly if cookieless embed was enabled. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Explore drill links now open correctly with cookieless embed enabled.
entry.title: Fixed: Explore drill links fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where generating a view inside a folder could fail if the folder's name contained special characters. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Generating a view inside a folder with special characters in its name will now work as expected.
entry.title: Fixed: View generation with special characters fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where generating an embed URL from a LookML dashboard could fail with the following error: 'models' param cannot be converted to an array of String. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The issue where generating an embed URL from a LookML dashboard could fail with an error has been resolved. The feature now works correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: Embed URL generation fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where loading JavaScript files for custom visualizations could take more than one second. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The loading time for JavaScript files used in custom visualizations has been improved and now performs as expected.
entry.title: Fixed: JavaScript loading time improved

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where non-admin users were unable to select a project when they added a connection. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Non-admin users can now select projects when adding connections. This issue is resolved and the feature functions correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: Project Selection Issue Fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where scheduled deliveries could fail with the following error message: Async delivery failed due to errors Internal server error. [Google Cloud Storage] undefined. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The issue causing scheduled deliveries to fail with a Google Cloud Storage error has been resolved. Deliveries will now proceed as expected.
entry.title: Fixed: Scheduled deliveries issue fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where subtotal rows could fail to appear in downloaded result sets. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: An issue where subtotal rows failed to appear in downloaded result sets has been resolved. The feature now functions correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: Subtotal Rows Issue Fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where the OAuth client secret could not be updated in the Connections page. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: The issue preventing updates to the OAuth client secret on the Connections page has been resolved. This functionality now operates correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: OAuth Client Secret Update Fixed

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where total references and row total references in table calculations could return the following error if there was no data: Field either does not exist in the current query or is a measure. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: An issue causing errors in table calculations with no data has been resolved. Total references and row total references now function correctly.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed: Table Calculation Error

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where updating a Spanner connection could fail to save changes. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: An issue where updating a Spanner connection could fail to save changes has been resolved. The feature now performs as expected.

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where users with only the embed_browse_spaces permission could be incorrectly classified as Standard users instead of Viewer users. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: Users with embed_browse_spaces permission are now correctly classified as Viewer users.

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where visualizations could render twice when they were first loaded on an Explore or a dashboard. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: An issue where visualizations rendered twice on initial load has been fixed. The feature now functions as expected.

entry.content: The Athena JDBC driver version has been downgraded from 2.2.1 to 2.1.5 to fix an issue with result set streaming. This feature now performs as expected. The Athena JDBC driver is used for connections to Amazon Athena.
entry.summary: The Athena JDBC driver has been downgraded to version 2.1.5, resolving a result set streaming issue. The feature now works correctly.

entry.content: Dashboards that are not configured to run on load no longer show past query results when you revisit the dashboard in the same browser session. You must click the Load button to run the queries again.
entry.summary: Dashboards not set to run on load will not display old results when revisited. Users must click 'Load' to refresh queries.

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where SQL Runner could fail to return new results after running a second query. This feature now performs as expected.

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where visualization templates could be edited by API users without the need for the explore permission.

entry.content: Looker (Google Cloud core) 90-day trial instances are now available.

entry.content:
Conversational Analytics in Looker

The following features are now available in Preview for use with Conversational Analytics in Looker instances that are running Looker 25.18 or later:

  • New model-specific Looker permissions are available to manage and use the Conversational Analytics data agents that are created to chat with Looker Explores. You can grant these permissions to users as part of a custom role, or use one of two new default roles, Conversational Analytics Agent Manager and Conversational Analytics User, to manage and use agents, respectively.
  • You can now select up to five Looker Explores as data sources for a data agent in Looker.
  • You can now share data agents to let other users chat with your agent and its Explores.

(This release note was updated on October 9, 2025 to correct the Looker version for this release.)
entry.summary: New features are available for Conversational Analytics in Looker, including model-specific permissions for data agents, the ability to select up to five Looker Explores as data sources for a data agent, and the option to share data agents with other users.
entry.title: Feature: New features for Conversational Analytics in Looker

entry.content:
The following updates have been made for Period-over-period (PoP) measures:

  • The PoP measure feature is out of Preview and is now generally available. Note: This item was added on August 21, 2025.
  • PoP measures are now supported for MySQL 8.0.12+ connections to Looker. Note: This item was added on August 18, 2025.
  • You can now specify the following types of measures in the PoP measure's based_on parameter: list, median, median_distinct, number, percentile, percentile_distinct. Note: This item was added on August 21, 2025.
  • For queries with PoP measures and time-based filters, in order to calculate data for the PoP measure Looker now automatically retrieves an extra time period of the coarsest time granularity in the query. (Previously, the user was required to adjust the granularity of time-based filters in order to account for the PoP measure calculations.) Note: This item was added on August 21, 2025.
  • For queries with PoP measures, if no time-based dimensions are included in the query from the Explore's field picker, Looker can now infer the time period from time-based dimensions in the Explore's filters. (Previously, for queries with PoP measures, the user was required to specify a time-based dimension from the Explore's field picker.) See Requirements for Explore queries with PoP measures for more information. Note: This item was added on August 21, 2025.
  • PoP measures are now supported with Connected Sheets. Note: This item was added on August 21, 2025.
entry.summary: Period-over-period measures are now generally available and support MySQL connections and Connected Sheets.
entry.title: Feature: PoP Measures Now Generally Available

entry.content:
Looker 25.14 contains the following accessibility improvements:

  • ARIA labels have been added to iframes that contain custom visualizations.
  • ARIA labels have been added to legends on visualizations.
  • ARIA labels have been added to modals.
  • ARIA labels have been added to the Looker page header and logo.
  • ARIA labels have been added to untitled dashboard tiles.
  • Keyboard focus has been improved on modals.
  • Text contrast has been increased on banners.
  • Dashboard filters stay in focus while users are typing.
  • Users can use the Explore from here link in a drill menu by using the keyboard.
  • Users can interact with Single Value visualizations by using the keyboard.
  • PDF rendering progress messages have been updated to better integrate with screen readers.

entry.content:
The Code Interpreter in Conversational Analytics is available in Preview for Looker (original) and Looker (Google Cloud core) instances. The Code Interpreter translates your natural language questions into Python code and executes that code to provide advanced analysis and visualizations. The Code Interpreter is disabled by default.

  • Looker (original) instances must be on Looker 25.8 or later. Looker admins can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the Gemini in Looker admin page of the Looker (original) instance.
  • Looker (Google Cloud core) instances must be on Looker 25.10 or later. Looker admins can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the Gemini in Looker admin page of the Looker (Google Cloud core) instance.
entry.summary: Introducing the Code Interpreter for advanced analysis and visualizations, now in Preview for Looker.
entry.title: Announcement: New Code Interpreter Feature

entry.content: For faster response time for queries in BigQuery, Looker will execute BigQuery queries by using jobCreationMode=JOB_CREATION_OPTIONAL. If BigQuery can return immediate results, it will run the query without creating a job, so the record in the Looker query history will have a BigQuery query ID instead of a BigQuery job ID. See the Understanding query performance metrics documentation page for more information about the BigQuery BI Engine metrics.
entry.summary: Looker now uses an improved method for running BigQuery queries, leading to faster response times.
entry.title: Feature: Faster BigQuery Queries in Looker

entry.content: The Query Concurrency System Activity Explore is now available. This Explore can help you identify periods of high load and investigate performance bottlenecks that are related to database connection limits. Note: This feature launch was delayed and is now available in Looker 25.14. This item was updated on August 13, 2025.
entry.summary: Query concurrency is now available to help identify load periods and investigate performance bottlenecks.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: Query Concurrency

entry.content:
The Embed SDK has been upgraded to release 2.0.0. While the 2.0.0 API is backwards-compatible with Embed SDK 1.8.x, the underlying implementation has changed for some functionality. SDK 1.8.x exported a number of classes. SDK 2.0.0 replaces these classes with interfaces that are marked as deprecated (alternative interfaces are identified). We recommend that applications use the interfaces that have an 'I' prefix (the interfaces that have prefixes are identical to the interfaces that don't have them). Applications that are upgraded to SDK 2.0.0 should continue to work and behave as they did previously. To take advantage of the API improvements, some refactoring will be required. The following major changes are included in Embed SDK 2.0.0:

  • Navigating between dashboards, Explores, and Looks no longer requires that an iframe be recreated. Instead, the loadDashboard, loadLook, loadExplore, and loadUrl methods can be used to navigate within the Looker iframe.
  • connect now returns a unified connection rather than a connection that is related only to a dashboard, a Look, or an Explore. The unified connection allows embedding applications to detect a user navigating inside the iframe.
  • Support for additional Looker embedded content has been added for Looker reports and query visualizations.

Note: This item was added on June 13, 2025.
entry.summary: The Embed SDK has been upgraded to version 2.0.0. This new version is backward-compatible with 1.8.x but introduces changes to how classes are exported, recommending the use of interfaces instead. Key improvements include eliminating the need to recreate iframes for navigation, a unified connection object for better event detection, and expanded support for Looker reports and query visualizations. Some refactoring may be needed to leverage the new features.
entry.title: Breaking: Embed SDK upgraded to 2.0.0

entry.content: For period-over-period (PoP) measures, a new subparameter, value_to_date, is available. When a PoP measure is defined with value_to_date:yes, Looker will calculate the amount of time in the current timeframe at the time that the query is run and apply that amount of time when it calculates the values for previous periods.
entry.summary: Looker's period-over-period measures now support a `value_to_date` subparameter. This allows for more accurate calculations of previous periods by considering the current timeframe when the query is executed.
entry.title: Feature: New subparameter for period-over-period measures

entry.content: The new Content Guardrails admin panel lets Looker admins limit both the ability for users to add or execute merged results queries on dashboards and the use of the dashboard auto-refresh option. Limiting merged results queries and dashboard auto-refreshes can reduce the number of queries that are sent to the database and improve dashboard performance. Note: This item was added on June 12, 2025.
entry.summary: Looker admins can now control user access to merged results queries and dashboard auto-refresh functionality. This feature helps reduce database load and enhance dashboard performance by limiting query execution.
entry.title: Feature: Control Merged Results and Auto-Refresh

entry.content: The Looker Continuous Integration (CI) features let you run tests on your LookML project to deliver more reliable, efficient, and user-friendly data experiences. You can use the CI validators to catch issues with SQL, data test, content, and LookML before they hit production to verify your LookML and prevent query errors for your users. You can also configure the CI validators to run automatically when a pull request is submitted to your LookML repository. Note: This item was added on June 23, 2025.
entry.summary: Looker's new Continuous Integration features enable automated testing of your LookML projects, catching SQL, data test, content, and LookML issues before they reach production. This ensures more reliable and user-friendly data experiences by preventing query errors.
entry.title: Feature: Looker CI Features

entry.content:
This release contains the following accessibility improvements:

  • Increased contrast ratio for graphic elements, including icon bullets
  • Improved contrast for download links and unemphasized text to comply with Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) Level AA

entry.title: Fixed: Fixed PDT rebuild issue

entry.content: You can now embed Looker reports on Looker (original) instances when Looker reports and the Embed Looker reports Labs features are enabled for your instance. Looker reports are available in preview.
entry.summary: Looker reports are now available for embedding on Looker (original) instances with the relevant features enabled. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Embedding Looker reports is now available

entry.content: An issue has been fixed where LDAP authentication could fail with the following error message: no implicit conversion of Hash into String. This feature now performs as expected.
entry.summary: LDAP authentication no longer fails with a hash to string conversion error.
entry.title: Fixed: Fixed LDAP authentication issue

entry.content: The Code Interpreter in Conversational Analytics is now available in Preview. The Code Interpreter translates your natural language questions into Python code and executes that code to provide advanced analysis and visualizations. The Code Interpreter is disabled by default. Admins of Looker (Google Cloud core) instances can manage enablement for the Code Interpreter on the Gemini in Looker admin page. Note: This item was added on June 23, 2025.
entry.summary: A new code interpreter feature is available for conversational analytics, allowing users to translate natural language questions into Python code for advanced analysis and visualizations. This feature is disabled by default and can be managed by instance administrators.
entry.title: Feature: New Code Interpreter Available for Conversational Analytics

entry.content:
Gemini in Looker will be enabled by default for Looker (original) instances that meet at least one of the following criteria:

  • The Automated Gemini in Looker enablement and user management setting on the Settings page in the Looker Admin panel was previously enabled.
  • The instance is updated to Looker 25.6 or later after June 9, 2025.

Instances that are hosted in the EMEA region and those that are enrolled in Looker's Extended Support Release (ESR) program are exempt from automatic enablement.

Looker admins can still manage Gemini in Looker enablement manually on the Gemini in Looker page in the Admin panel.
entry.summary: Gemini in Looker will be automatically enabled by default for Looker (original) instances starting with version 25.6, provided they meet specific criteria or had the feature enabled previously. However, instances in the EMEA region or those in the ESR program are exempt from this automatic enablement. Admins retain manual control over the feature
entry.title: Announcement: Gemini in Looker enablement update

entry.content: When the Automated Gemini in Looker enablement and user management setting is enabled, the Gemini Default Users group is created automatically for instances that use an open system configuration. The Gemini Default Users group is populated automatically with all existing users and any new users who are added to the instance.
entry.summary: A new feature is available for Looker, regarding the Automated Gemini enablement and user management. When the relevant setting is enabled, a Gemini Default Users group is automatically created and populated with all existing and new users for instances using an open system configuration.
entry.title: Feature: Automated Gemini in Looker
